meanings.definition: Not wise; lacking good sense or judgment.
meanings.sent1: She made the unwisest decision by not studying for the test.
meanings.sent2: It was the unwisest choice to go out without an umbrella in the rain.
meanings.sent3: He felt unwisest when he tried to fix the broken computer with a hammer.
meanings.sent4: Ignoring the warning signs was the unwisest move she could make.
meanings.sent5: The unwisest move in the game was to attack the strongest opponent first.

meanings.definition: Superlative form of unwise; showing the least wisdom.
meanings.sent1: Out of all the decisions, that was the unwisest one she could have made.
meanings.sent2: He proved to be the unwisest of all the candidates during the debate.
meanings.sent3: The unwisest move in the chess game was sacrificing the queen for a pawn.
meanings.sent4: Choosing to drive without a seatbelt was the unwisest risk he took.
meanings.sent5: The unwisest choice in the story was to trust the villain with the secret.
